thread.title: Storm Doris travel chaos: How to get home in Greater Manchester tonight - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Storm Doris travel chaos: How to get home in Greater Manchester tonight - Manchester Evening News

author: Lee Swettenham
title: Storm Doris travel chaos: How to get home in Greater Manchester tonight - Manchester Evening News
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
High winds and heavy rain caused by Storm Doris have caused big problems on transport networks across Greater Manchester, with disruption set to continue into today's evening rush-hour. 
The Met Office had issued an amber warning of strong winds gusting up to 80mph throughout today, and the warning for our region remains in place until 8pm. 
The train network appears to have been worst affected with many cancellations to services between Manchester and major cities including Liverpool and London. 
Some flights out of Manchester Airport have been cancelled while some incoming flights were diverted to neighbouring airports. 
Some roads are also closed after trees fell on them. 
Here's what you need to know if you're thinking about your route home tonight ... Trains: 
All Virgin Trains services have been cancelled between Manchester and London. 
A Virgin spokesman said: “Due to Storm Doris, our West Coast services are severely disrupted for at least the next few hours. 
“We are running an hourly service between London and Birmingham, and between London and Stafford, as well as an hourly service between Preston and Scotland. 
“All other services are currently suspended. We strongly advise anyone who can postpone their journey to do so. Tickets for today will be accepted for journeys starting before 2pm tomorrow (Friday February 24), or anytime on Saturday.” View gallery 
All Northern trains are subject to possible delays or cancellation until the end of the day, the network announced. 
The service provider said: “Shortly after 11.35am the storm caused problems to the overhead wires at Liverpool Lime Street and, as a result, all services in and out of the station are likely to be subject to delays and cancellations. 
“There are also blockages on the lines at Cheadle Hulme, Clifton, Handforth, Holmes Chapel and Plumley, all of which will impact on services passing through those stations.” 
The following Northern services are cancelled: 15:18 Leeds to Manchester Victoria due 16:42 15:26 Leeds to Manchester Victoria due 17:03 15:31 Wigan North Western to Liverpool Lime Street due 16:20 15:59 Chester to Manchester Piccadilly due 17:31 
There are also cancellations to Northern services between Macclesfield and Stoke-on-Trent, Manchester and Crewe, and Manchester and Chester, plus cancellations to services at Guide Bridge. 
The following Northern services are delayed: 15:11 Bridlington to Sheffield due 17:20 15:18 York to Blackpool North due 18:15 15:20 Blackburn to Clitheroe due 17:50 15:25 Lincoln to Adwick due 17:43 15:28 Clitheroe to Manchester Victoria due 16:39 15:29 Buxton to Barrow-In-Furness due 18:56 15:30 Preston to Liverpool South Pw Hl due 16:54 15:41 Sheffield to Bridlington due 18:01 15:46 Manchester Piccadilly to Stoke-On-Trent due 16:39 15:48 Manchester Victoria to Selby due 17:56 16:03 Manchester Airport to Southport due 17:37 16:11 Bridlington to Sheffield due 18:20 16:15 Huddersfield to Southport due 18:15 16:16 Manchester Victoria to Leeds due 17:45 16:20 Blackburn to Wigan Wallgate due 18:21 16:25 Scarborough to Sheffield due 19:17 16:25 Leeds to York due 17:03 16:41 Sheffield to Bridlington due 19:00 16:59 Stoke-On-Trent to Manchester Piccadilly due 17:56 16:59 Huddersfield to Leeds due 17:34 17:41 Sheffield to Scarborough due 20:43 17:53 Blackpool North to Hazel Grove due 19:49 
Get live updates on Northern services here . 
Further disruptions were causing delays of up to two hours on some routes, including those served by Manchester Piccadilly and Bolton stations. 
Transpennine Express, which operates services between Leeds, Liverpool and Manchester Airport said high winds are rain were affecting its trains, along with failure of the electricity supply at Liverpool Lime Street. 
If your ticket is for travel on a TransPennine Express service today, and you decide not to travel then you will be able to use your ticket on TransPennine Express services on Friday 24 February instead. 
You may use your ticket on Northern services. Read More
